parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.32

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Lights

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns [[true]] if vehicle headlights are on otherwise [[false]].  
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Informative </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> Since Arma 3 v1.94 it is possible to get the status of a search light on a turret (see alt syntax).</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[isLightOn]] vehicle

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> vehicle: [[Object]] - vehicle with headlights

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Boolean]]

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> [[isLightOn]] [vehicle, turret]

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> vehicle: [[Object]] - vehicle with search light on a turret

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> turret: [[Array]] - turret path

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Boolean]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_headlightsOn = [[isLightOn]] [[vehicle]] [[player]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_pilotLightOn = [[isLightOn]] heli;</code>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>_searchLightOn = [[isLightOn]] [heli, [0]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[setPilotLight]], [[isCollisionLightOn]], [[setCollisionLight]], [[isIRLaserOn]]
</value></part></template></root>
